unnormalised: The chaos at the Saharanpur RTO on Mon morning, Oct 23rd, stemmed from a sudden server outage. Citizens lined up since 8:00 AM for DL renewals, vehicle registrations, and most importantly, to obtain their Aadhaar-linked Driving Licenses (DLs). Many, like Rakesh Kumar, a local farmer, had traveled from distant villages, hoping to complete the process before the Diwali rush. He needed to update his address on his DL (UP72-2023-xxxxx456) to avail of the govt's new fertilizer subsidy program.
normalised: The chaos at the Saharanpur R-T-O on Monday morning, October twenty third, stemmed from a sudden server outage. Citizens lined up since eight zero zero A-M for D-L renewals, vehicle registrations, and most importantly, to obtain their Aadhaar-linked Driving Licenses (D-Ls). Many, like Rakesh Kumar, a local farmer, had traveled from distant villages, hoping to complete the process before the Diwali rush. He needed to update his address on his D-L (U-P seventy two two thousand and twenty three dash xxxxx four hundred and fifty six) to avail of the government's new fertilizer subsidy program.

unnormalised: The problem started around 9:30 AM. "Everything just froze," complained Anita Devi, who was attempting to register her newly purchased scooty. "The computer operator said the server was down, and we just had to wait." The delay quickly escalated tensions, with tempers flaring amidst the already crowded conditions. The main issue was the mandatory Aadhaar seeding for all govt issued IDs like Voter ID (EPI C987654321).
normalised: The problem started around nine thirty A-M. "Everything just froze," complained Anita Devi, who was attempting to register her newly purchased scooty. "The computer operator said the server was down, and we just had to wait." The delay quickly escalated tensions, with tempers flaring amidst the already crowded conditions. The main issue was the mandatory Aadhaar seeding for all government issued I-Ds like Voter I-D (E-P-I C nine eight seven six five four three two one).

unnormalised: Compounding the problem, many applicants were unaware of the specific documents required. Suresh Sharma, a retired schoolteacher, discovered he needed a self-attested copy of his PAN card (ABCDE1234F) despite bringing his original. He'd traveled all the way from Muzaffarnagar after receiving a message to link his DL to his Aadhaar number, 1234-5678-9012, before the deadline.

He'd traveled all the way from Muzaffarnagar after receiving a message to link his D-L to his Aadhaar number, one two three four dash five six seven eight dash nine zero one two, before the deadline.

unnormalised: Adding to the frustration, officials were struggling to provide accurate information. "We were only informed of the server issue minutes before it happened," explained a junior clerk, requesting anonymity. "We are doing our best to manage the crowd, but the lack of communication from the higher-ups isn't helping."

unnormalised: By midday, the situation was near boiling point. A small protest erupted outside the RTO building, with citizens demanding immediate resolution. Police were called in to control the crowd and prevent any potential security breach. Senior RTO officials arrived around 1:00 PM, assuring the public that engineers were working to restore the server.

Senior R-T-O officials arrived around one zero zero P-M, assuring the public that engineers were working to restore the server.

unnormalised: Finally, around 3:00 PM, the system was back online. However, the backlog meant many had to return the next day. Rakesh Kumar, after waiting for seven hrs, was finally able to update his DL. While many applicants were relieved, the incident highlighted the need for better infrastructure and communication regarding essential services linked to identifiers like Aadhaar and Voter IDs. Furthermore, the incident raised questions on the single point of failure due to over reliance on Aadhaar which impacted regular renewals of DLs, registration of vehicles and other important functions.
